net.cloud.server.logging

Class Logger

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.cloud.server.logging.Logger
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ShutdownService

    public class Logger
extends Object
implements ShutdownService
    The front to the logging system. The only "point of contact" other systems should need to have. This is the place for reports to be submitted. There are factory style methods that will take care of creation of the report and then submit them for saving.

      • logException

        public void logException(String msg,
                         Throwable ex)
        Submit a log detailing that an exception happened. The default log file will be used.
        Parameters:
        msg - A brief message detailing what happened
        ex - The exception that occurred

      • logException

        public void logException(String msg,
                         Throwable ex,
                         LogSection section)
        Submit a log detailing that an exception happened. The specified log file will be used.
        Parameters:
        msg - A brief message detailing what happened
        ex - The exception that occurred
        section - Which log file this report should be placed in

      • logMessage

        public void logMessage(String msg,
                       LogSection section)
        Submit a log detailing some message. A straight forward and simple report. The specified log file will be used.
        Parameters:
        msg - The message to report
        section - Which log file this report should be placed in

      • logMessage

        public void logMessage(String msg)
        Submit a log detailing some message. A straight forward and simple report. The default log file will be used.
        Parameters:

      • logCommand

        Submit a log detailing some command that was used on the server.
        Parameters:

        results - The results of that command

      • logStats

        public void logStats(StatContainer stats)
        Submit a report detailing the status of the system
        Parameters:
        stats - The object with the status information

      • logWriter

        public PrintWriter logWriter()
        Obtain a PrintWriter which will write to both standard output and a log file for it. Note that you will still need to flush the writer to make the text appear in the console, but this will not flush the file as well. Closing the writer will do nothing, standard out cannot be closed and the file should not be closed outside of the logging system.
        If logging is not enabled, this writer will just be SYS_OUT
        Returns:
        The PrintWriter described above.

      • writer

        public static PrintWriter writer()
        Convenience call for Logger.instance.logWriter()
        Returns:
        The PrintWriter described in logWriter()

      • getShutdownHook

        public ShutdownHook getShutdownHook()
                             throws NullPointerException
        Obtain the hook to stop this Logger. On shutdown, it will no longer accept any more reports but will continue to save reports until there are none left queued. This hook will be left null if logging is not enabled (via the LOGGING_ENABLED constant)
        Specified by:
        getShutdownHook in interface ShutdownService
        Returns:
        The ShutdownHook responsible for this service
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If the hook is not available
